A-RANK

Mission 14: Grammar & Conventions

Demonstrate Command of Standard English Grammar

[SYSTEM NOTIFICATION]
A Literary Gate has been detected. Difficulty: A-Rank.
Hunter Hyro, master the rules of grammar - the foundation of all powerful writing!

The Challenge Awaits

Grammar and conventions are the rules that govern how we write and speak. Like the combat rules that guide hunters in battle, mastering grammar ensures your writing is clear, professional, and powerful.

Your mission? Demonstrate mastery of pronoun usage and paragraph editing through multiple practice exercises.

Hunter Equipment

  • Pencil and eraser
  • Grammar reference guide
  • Editing checklist

Skills to Unlock

Power Standard PS14
The student will demonstrate command of standard English grammar.

Training Scrolls

Pronoun Types:

  • Subjective: I, you, he, she, it, we, they (used as subjects)
  • Objective: me, you, him, her, it, us, them (used as objects)
  • Possessive: my, your, his, her, its, our, their (show ownership)

Dungeon Raid

Official Quest Instructions

Students will complete multiple worksheets focusing on pronoun shifts, pronoun types, corrections, and paragraph editing.

Your Quest Materials

Shifts In Pronouns - Complete this worksheet Subjective/Objective/Possessive Pronouns - Complete this worksheet Corrections Using Pronouns - Complete this worksheet Editing Paragraph Directions - Read these instructions Eleanor Roosevelt Editing Paragraph - Edit this paragraph

Raid Strategy Guide

Step 1: Know Your Pronoun Cases

Subject: "She wrote the essay" (doing the action)
Object: "Give the book to her" (receiving the action)
Possessive: "That is her book" (showing ownership)

Step 2: Avoid Pronoun Shifts

Keep pronouns consistent. If you start with "you," don't switch to "one" or "they" mid-paragraph. Pick a perspective and stick with it.

Step 3: Check Pronoun-Antecedent Agreement

Pronouns must match their antecedents (the words they replace) in number and gender. "Each student" takes "his or her," not "their."

Step 4: Edit Carefully

When editing, read slowly. Check each sentence for subject-verb agreement, pronoun usage, punctuation, and spelling.

Step 5: Complete All Exercises

Work through each worksheet. The Eleanor Roosevelt paragraph is your final boss - apply everything you've learned!

Guild Master Verification

STOP! Summon your Guild Master (Parent/Guardian) for verification.

  • [ ] Shifts In Pronouns worksheet complete
  • [ ] Subjective/Objective/Possessive worksheet complete
  • [ ] Corrections Using Pronouns worksheet complete
  • [ ] Eleanor Roosevelt paragraph edited correctly
  • [ ] All grammar rules applied correctly
